intro: Physopodium volubile, commonly known as the climbing cress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its trailing stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Physopodium volubile is often found growing in moist, shady areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
